isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - ROCKWELL 9, 10, AND 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS - CLEAN AND INSPECT - INSPECT

svcprocinfo.para: It is important to inspect all parts before the transmission is assembled. Check all parts for wear and replace damaged parts. Replacement of damaged parts now will prevent failure of the assembly later.

svcsubproc.title: Tapered Roller Bearing Cone

note.para: The bearing cup and bearing cone must be replaced as an assembly except when the cup is loose in the bore. If the cup is loose in the bore, install an oversize cup. In all other situations, do not replace the cup or the cone separately. Replace the cup and cone in a matched set from the same manufacturer.

svcsubproc.para: Inspect the cup, cone, rollers and cage of all tapered roller bearings. If any of the following conditions exist, the cup and cone must be replaced.

step1.para: The outer surface of the large diameter end of the rollers is worn level with or below the center ( Figure 12).
The radius at the large diameter end of the rollers is worn to a sharp edge ( Figure 12).

figure.caption: Figure 12. Worn Outer Surface and Worn Radius

step1.para: A visible roller groove is worn in the inner race surfaces of the cup or the cone. The groove can be seen at the small or large diameter end of both parts ( Figure 13).
Deep cracks or breaks in the surface of the cup, cone inner race or roller ( Figure 14).
Bright wear marks on the outer surface of the roller cage ( Figure 15).
Etching or pitting on rollers and on the surfaces of the cup and cone inner race that touch the rollers ( Figure 15.)

figure.caption: Figure 15. Bright Wear Marks and Etching or Pitting

step1.para: Spalling or flaking on the cup and cone inner face surfaces that touch the rollers ( Figure 16).

note.para: The bearing cup and bearing cone must be replaced as an assembly except when the cup is loose in the bore. If the cup is loose in the bore, install an oversize cup. In all other situations, do not replace the cup or cone separately. Replace the cup and cone in a matched set from the same manufacturer.

step1.para: Normal cup wear is shown as an even wear across the surface of the cup ( Figure 17). Small indentations are acceptable.
Replace cups with small spalling or flaking marks or light bruising ( Figure 18).

figure.caption: Figure 18. Cup with Small Spalls And Bruises

step1.para: Replace cups with large spalls and deep indentations (Figure 19).

svcsubproc.title: 5.1.3. Ball Bearings
svcsubproc.para: Inspect ball bearings for wear and damage. Make sure the bearings rotate in the race. Make sure the outer race is not worn or damaged. On bearings with grooves, make sure the grooves are not worn or damaged. Replace any worn or damaged bearings.

svcsubproc.title: 5.1.4. Gears
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the teeth of the gears for wear and damage. Inspect the splines inside the gears for wear and damage. Inspect the gears for cracks or pits. Replace gears that are worn, damaged, or cracked.

svcsubproc.title: 5.1.5. Shafts
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the splines and groves for wear and damage. Make sure the shafts are not twisted. Make sure threads on the end of the shafts are not worn or damaged. Replace any worn or damaged shafts.

svcsubproc.title: 5.1.6. O-Rings and Oil Seals
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the O-rings and oil seals for cuts and cracks. Make sure the parts are not brittle or hard. Replace any worn, damaged or hard O-rings and oil seals.

svcsubproc.title: 5.1.7. Clutch Collars
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the teeth of the outside of the clutch collar for wear and damage. Inspect the splines inside the clutch collar for wear and damage. Replace any worn or damaged clutch collars.

svcsubproc.title: 5.1.8. Case Housings
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the case housings for cracks. Replace cracked housings.

svcsubproc.title: 5.1.9. Top Cover
svcsubproc.para: Inspect tips of the forks for wear and damage. Make sure forks are not bent. Make sure the shift rails are not worn or damaged. Inspect balls and springs for wear or damage. Replace any worn or damaged parts.

svcsubproc.title: 5.1.10. Output Yokes
svcsubproc.para: Inspect the seal surface, splines and end of the output yoke for wear and damage. Do not sand or grind the seal surface. Replace any worn or damaged parts.
